comments.content: This feature is for setting up preventive maintenance, which is not performed based on internal requests, rather an automated maintenance schedule.

discussion.content: "You can create maintenance requests by using the Schedule maintenance plans feature" is yes

Yes, you can create maintenance requests using the "Schedule maintenance plans" feature in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. This feature allows you to set up and schedule maintenance activities for equipment, machines, or assets within your organization. When the scheduled maintenance is due or triggered based on predefined criteria, maintenance requests can be automatically generated, helping you effectively manage and track maintenance tasks and workflows.

Instructions: For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content: Have this question in the exam today.

When running a trace on raw materials in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management, the two types of products that can be seen in the trace output are:

A. Finished products
D. Co-products

Finished products are the end products that are produced from the raw materials, while co-products are the intermediate products that are produced in conjunction with the finished products. Non-stocked items and by-products are not typically included in a trace of raw materials as they are not directly related to the production of the finished products.

Therefore, options A and D are the correct answers.

Selected Answer: AD
The answer is A. Finished products and D. Co-products.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

A company uses Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management.

You need to recommend costing methods for the company.

What should you recommend? To answer, drag the appropriate costing methods to the correct scenarios. Each costing method may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

Which two modules are included in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
The two modules included in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management are:

A. Product information management: This module enables organizations to manage their product information, including product configuration, pricing, and attributes. It also allows for the creation of bills of materials, routes, and operations for the manufacturing process.

C. Master planning: This module enables organizations to plan and manage their supply chain operations, including demand forecasting, inventory management, and production planning. It also includes features for scheduling and capacity planning.

Dynamics 365 Remote Assist, Service Hub, and Project management and accounting are not included in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. Remote Assist is a separate application for remote assistance and collaboration, Service Hub is a customer service management solution, and Project management and accounting is a separate module for managing project finances and operations.
Question was to answer two modules so why only A is selected as correct answer? It should be A & C.

Selected Answer: C
A&C are correct

Master Planning and Product Information Management are both included in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. 

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/identify-general-capabilities-of-microsoft-dynamics/2-overview-supply-chain-module

How can it be only A the answer, if two modules are requested ?
Surely A, C. But also E is a Supply Chain Management module.

Selected Answer: C
A and C (Product information management and Master planning)

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/supply-chain/
